meanings.definition: A man employed to run alongside a carriage or horse to attend to it.
meanings.sent1: The footmen hurriedly followed the carriage, making sure it stayed on the right path.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy family's footmen were always ready to assist with any carriage-related tasks.
meanings.sent3: The footmen comically tried to keep up with the fast carriage, stumbling over their own feet.
meanings.sent4: The footmen were like loyal shadows to the carriage, never straying too far.
meanings.sent5: The image of the footmen running beside the elegant carriage was etched in her memory.

meanings.sent1: The footmen marched bravely on the battlefield, ready to defend their land.
meanings.sent2: In the army, footmen play a crucial role in ground operations.
meanings.sent3: The footmen joked about their heavy boots, making light of the tough march ahead.
meanings.sent4: The footmen stood firm like pillars, holding their ground against the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The footmen's determination in battle inspired others to fight alongside them.

meanings.definition: A male servant who attends to the needs of a household.
meanings.sent1: The footmen in the grand mansion were always ready to assist the family with their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The footmen ensured that every corner of the house was immaculately clean.
meanings.sent3: The footmen comically juggled multiple tasks, trying to keep up with the household's demands.
meanings.sent4: The footmen's dedication to their duties made the household run smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The footmen's presence brought an air of elegance and efficiency to the household.
